conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on block A in both scenarios: when θ = 37° and when θ = 30° with the cylinder B placed between A and the inclined plane.

Forces acting on block A: Gravitational force (weight) acting vertically downward: Mg, Normal force from the inclined plane acting perpendicular to the plane: N, Friction force acting parallel to the plane: f

premise: Gravitational force acting on block A
conclusion: Components of gravitational force: Parallel to the plane: Mg sin 37°, Perpendicular to the plane: Mg cos 37°

premise: Block can just rest on the inclined plane

conclusion: Forces acting on block A: Gravitational force (weight) acting vertically downward: Mg, Normal force from the inclined plane: N1, Normal force from the cylinder B: N2, Friction force acting parallel to the plane: f

premise: Gravitational force acting on block A
conclusion: Components of gravitational force: Parallel to the plane: Mg sin 30°, Perpendicular to the plane: Mg cos 30°
Equilibrium condition: f = Mg sin 30° - N2

premise: Normal forces acting on block A
conclusion: Normal forces: N1 + N2 = Mg cos 30°
Determine N2: N2 is such that f is minimized

premise: Assume N2 is adjusted such that f balances the forces parallel to the plane
conclusion: The friction force f is: f = 2mg
